episode_summary: Deputy Sheriff Rick Grimes wakes up in the hospital, after being shot, to find his town overrun by flesh-eating zombies. After making friends with survivor Morgan Jones and his son Duane, Rick sets out to find his wife and son.
Rick finds himself trapped with other survivors inside a department store, surrounded by walkers.

Rick is reunited with Lori and Carl, but soon decides - along with some of the other survivors - to return to the rooftop and rescue Merle. Back at camp, tensions run high between the other survivors.

While searching for Merle, Rick and the others come across another group of - seemingly hostile - survivors. Meanwhile, back at camp, Jim is deeply disturbed by a dream he cannot fully remember, a dream which may turn out to be prophetic.

The survivors deal with the aftermath of the walker attack and decide to move to the C.D.C., hoping to find a cure for an infected Jim. Meanwhile, Shane - finding his leadership position challenged by Rick, succumbs to his inner demons.

At the C.D.C., Rick and the others find Dr. Edwin Jenner, a scientist who is on the verge of suicide. But just when they think they're safe, Jenner tells them that the building is on a countdown to self-destruct.
The group heads for Fort Benning, but during an encounter with a herd of walkers Sophia goes missing. Rick and the others try to track her down.
After Carl gets shot, Rick and Shane find a family in a nearby house. Shane and Otis decide to go to the local high school in search of medical supplies.
Shane and Otis try to dodge the walkers as they head back to the house. Meanwhile, Carl's condition continues to deteriorate.
With Carl recovering, the group, once again, puts their focus on finding Sophia.
While searching for Sophia, Daryl becomes injured and stranded in the middle of the woods. Meanwhile, Lori doesn't know how to tell Rick that she is pregnant.

Glenn tells Dale that Lori is pregnant and there are numerous walkers in the Greene barn. Meanwhile, Shane attempts to teach Andrea how to use weapons and Lori agonizes over the decision whether to terminate her pregnancy or keep the baby.
Glenn reveals to the group that there are walkers in the Greenes' barn, dividing the group on what to do. Meanwhile, Hershel sets a deadline for the group to leave, unless Rick does a difficult task.
The group bury Sophia's body and burn the rest. Hershel disappears just as Beth falls into shock. Rick and Glenn head out to find him.
Rick, Glenn, and Hershel come under enemy fire in a nearby town. Shane is starting to turn more savage. Lori fears for her family.
Rick and Shane try to decide what to do with their new captive, Randall. Meanwhile, Lori and Maggie try to stop Beth from committing suicide.

Rick and the group decide to execute Randall, much to the frustration of Dale, who fears the group are losing it's humanity. Meanwhile, Carl behaves recklessly, which initiates grave consequences for the group.
Shane's antagonistic behaviour reaches new heights, while Carl suffers the consequences of his actions.
As the Greene farm is overrun by walkers, Rick and the others fight to escape. Andrea is separated from the group in the chaos.
The group takes refuge in a federal prison. Michonne cares for an ailing Andrea.
The group negotiates with a group of prisoners, while Hershel's health continues to deteriorate.
Andrea and Michonne are brought to a human civilization camp run by a man called The Governor.
Someone inside the prison is luring the walkers toward the group. Andrea is having mixed feelings about leaving Woodbury.
Rick mopes over Lori's death. Daryl and Maggie try to find food and clothes for the baby. Michonne wants to leave Woodbury.
Rick receives a mysterious phone call. Daryl, Carl, and Oscar search the other areas of the prison for walkers. Merle tries to hunt down Michonne.
Michonne leads Rick, Daryl, and Oscar to Woodbury to rescue Glenn and Maggie. Merle tries to force information out of Glenn.
Rick, Daryl, Michonne and Oscar enter Woodbury in search of Glenn and Maggie. Meanwhile, a new group of survivors encounter the prison.
After the invasion of Woodbury by Rick's group, Daryl and Merle are captured by The Governor. Rick decides the fate of Tyreese's group.
Rick begins to see visions of Lori and asks Hershel for help. Meanwhile, The Governor plans an assault on the prison while Daryl and Merle defend for themselves out in the forest.
Rick and the group debate their next course of action, while The Governor prepares Woodbury for battle. Meanwhile, Andrea decides to travel to the prison to negotiate with Rick's group.

Rick, Carl, and Michonne head back to Rick's hometown to find more guns to fortify themselves against The Governor. Rick runs into a familiar friend. Michonne and Carl head out to find something important.
Rick and The Governor meet face-to-face, ostensibly to make a peaceful resolution to prevent further bloodshed. Meanwhile, tensions arise between Merle and the rest of the group at the prison.
The Governor hunts down Andrea when she flees Woodbury, and tensions arise within Tyreese's group. Meanwhile, a traitor attempts to sabotage the upcoming meeting between Rick and The Governor.
Rick decides the fate of Michonne. One of the group betrays Rick. The Governor and his group head to the meeting area.
Rick and the group have to seriously consider if the prison is worth defending as The Governor's impending attack looms over their heads.
Several months have passed and Rick and the expanded group are living an ideal life at the prison; however problems surface when Rick encounters a new survivor, while a supply run ends in disaster.
As the group faces a brand new enemy, Rick and the others must fight to protect the livelihood they worked so hard to create at the prison.
While Daryl, Tyreese, Michonne and Bob leave the prison in search of medical supplies, Rick and the others deal with the losses of Karen and David as more people start to become ill.
Daryl, Tyreese, Michonne and Bob continue to the Veterinary Medical Center on foot in search of medicine. Rick and Carol go on a run to a nearby town where they find two uninfected stragglers.
Hershel struggles to care for the sick as the situation in the cell block escalates. Meanwhile, Rick and Carl defend the prison as the fences give way.
The Governor bonds with a small family following the downfall of Woodbury.
The Governor is haunted by his past as he adjusts to new surroundings.
Rick and the group face imminent danger as The Governor tries to take the prison.
